result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L. Bosner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Counseling shall specifically include the following:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
** Pay fine of $2500.27   and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case to be determined within 60 days.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Not to drive without valid driver's license.

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Henderson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 36 months WSP consecutive to 01CF464 & 01CF33; 18 months initial confinement; 18 months extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; $2,500.27 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge and $250 DNA surcharge), to be paid during period of extended supervision; 3 year revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Henderson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  SEH 5/29/14 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Henderson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Henderson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  FPT continued to 5/28/14 at 3pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Douglas Henderson. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 5-8-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
